1.text: Run your finger over any designs to ensure they’re under the glaze.

2.text: Scrub standard porcelain with a warm water and a mild dish soap.

3.text: Wash standard porcelain in the dishwasher on the lowest power setting.

4.text: Use baking soda and water to spot clean porcelain.

5.text: Soak dishes in a vinegar solution for 2-3 hours to soften serious stains.

6.text: Rub lemon juice and salt into the porcelain to remove rust stains.

7.text: Soak heavily-stained porcelain in hydrogen peroxide for 2-3 days.

8.text: Rinse off painted porcelain gently by hand with plain water.

9.text: Scrape painted porcelain with a rubber scraper to remove food residue.

10.text: Brush decorative porcelain with a soft, dry brush to get rid of dust.

11.text: Wipe antique porcelain periodically with a dry microfiber cloth to remove dust.
